channel.title: Need a good java idea
channel.description: So I really want to program something that would be useful and challenging, since I haven't done so in a while. I am horrible at anything server-client or web based, but that is really my only weakness. So I was hoping someone would give me an idea, I have searched through lists and I have done everything that isn't too easy, nor too hard. I you could just throw out ideas, that would really help me out,

item.title: Need a good java idea
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Create a simple game engine with software rendering.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good java idea
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Scyth_, post:6, topic:527712”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=646465.msg4347553#msg4347553 date=1376105347]

An idea for a project would be completely based upon your experience in Java. It would be far-fetched for someone to suggest an idea that you have no understanding of. What are you capable of doing?

I am great with most swing components and java 2d. Basically I could manage anything that’s not web based or server-client.

If you are interested with creating a game, I would go with a 2D engine such as Slick. I started a text-based game and used Swing to add functionality and theme to the program, but I just realized I was creating a 2D game without the graphics rendering/updating support that 2D engines generally offer. I’ve always wanted to create an RPG to start off game development.
[/quote]

I could easily make an RPG, but making Textures isn’t my strong point. If you want some help with making an RPG, I could help with that.[/quote]
I don’t think textures will be a problem, especially since there are tons of sprites out there. I am coming across a few issues with design and logic, and I haven’t been using Slick for too long, so help would be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good java idea
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

http://processing.org/
The syntax is exactly the same of that of Java.
Basically, it is Java but it has alot of built-in functions.
Really fun to make some visual stuff on.

Read full topic

then markov chains might be 1 thing u want to look at

I am great with most swing components and java 2d. Basically I could manage anything that’s not web based or server-client.

If you are interested with creating a game, I would go with a 2D engine such as Slick. I started a text-based game and used Swing to add functionality and theme to the program, but I just realized I was creating a 2D game without the graphics rendering/updating support that 2D engines generally offer.
